com.clarionmedia.infinitum.activity.annotation

Annotation Type Bind


  • @Documented
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=FIELD)
public @interface Bind

    Indicates that the annotated View is to be bound to a callback method for a given event type.

    The event attribute corresponds to the event type, while callback indicates the name of the method to be invoked. If an ActivityInjector.Event is not specified, Event.OnClick is used by default.

    The callback method should match the normal listener method in terms of its return type and arguments. For example, an onClick callback should be void and take a View as its argument, while an onKey callback must return a boolean and take a View, int, and KeyEvent as its arguments.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0 07/19/12
    Author:
    Tyler Treat
    See Also:
    InjectView

      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      ActivityInjector.Event event
      Declares the event type for this binding.

        public abstract ActivityInjector.Event event
        Declares the event type for this binding. Defaults to Event.OnClick.
        Returns:

        Default:
